body_html:
People over at the Bazel Github page have encountered this issue but were apparently able to fix it by using the install version of bazel as compared to the Homebrew version of bazel (which is weird since Homebrew should be compiling it from source). You can see some of the discussion at the bottom of bazelbuild/bazel/issues/4794.

I have encountered this issue, but I have not tried their solution. It sounds to me like its a problem with bazel not detecting the correct architecture. I will, however, note that if I compile with version 0.11.1 from Homebrew that I get an unrelated error.

I will be trying various solutions and seeing if I can get anything to work.

I have encountered this issue, but I have not tried their solution. It sounds to me like its a problem with bazel not detecting the correct architecture. I will, however, note that if I compile with version 0.11.1 from Homebrew that I get an unrelated error.
I will be trying various solutions and seeing if I can get anything to work.
body:
People over at the Bazel Github page have encountered this issue but were apparently able to fix it by using the install version of bazel as compared to the Homebrew version of bazel (which is weird since Homebrew should be compiling it from source). You can see some of the discussion at the bottom of bazelbuild/bazel/issues/4794. 

I have encountered this issue, but I have not tried their solution. It sounds to me like its a problem with bazel not detecting the correct architecture. I will, however, note that if I compile with version 0.11.1 from Homebrew that I get an unrelated error.

I will be trying various solutions and seeing if I can get anything to work.
